markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="">[Yaiafineti](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2504)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Yaiafinetis grow only during periods of extended twilight, thriving across the cold tundra of the Crown of the World exclusively in the winter months. To survive in such harsh conditions, the yaiafineti, or dusk poppy, sprouts independent polyps that detach and then creep across the tundra in search of food for their matriarch.

 Dusk poppies sprout from spores that attach to carcasses, but they only blossom during the long twilight unique to the Crown of the World. The perfect conditions for their development are so rare that yaiafineti have developed a vigorous appetite. They feed unceasingly. Much of their energy goes to developing more polyps, and one plant can easily spawn a small infestation of these deadly bulbs.

 The plants send out runner shoots that quickly develop purple bulbs. These bulbs, the plant's polyps, sprout many long, hooked vines before detaching from the mother plant. Polyps are short lived but active, foraging for a week or so before they shrivel and die. These polyps aren't dangerous unless handled. They secrete a fine dust that acts as a paralyzing poison that seizes the nervous system of creatures who come in contact with them.

 **Paralyzing Poison** (poison) **Saving Throw** DC 19 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) and [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3) (1 round); **Stage 2** flat-footed and clumsy 2 (1 round); **Stage 3** [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28) (1 round)

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 26

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 24

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Yaiafineti.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 8">[Yaiafineti](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2504)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Mindless" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=108" />
<trait label="Plant" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=125" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #189: Dreamers of the Nameless Spires](/Sources.aspx?ID=195) pg. 87</row>

**Perception** +16; pheromones (precise) 20 feet, [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=40) (imprecise) 120 feet, no vision

**Languages**
pheromones

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +18, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +7

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** -5

**Con** +6

**Int** -5

**Wis** +3

**Cha** +0
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 24 

**Fort** +19 

**Ref** +11 

**Will** +13 

</row>

**HP** 170

**Immunities**
[mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)

**Resistances**
[cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27) 10

**Weaknesses**
[fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72) 5, slashing 5

**Pheromones** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206)) 5 miles. Yaiafinetis communicate with others of their kind via airborne pheromones. They can use this form of communication to determine their relative distance to each other, call for help if they are under attack or need sustenance, announce that they've detected prey, and convey similar basic concepts. Pheromones coat everything within the aura and allow all dusk poppies to perceive with their pheromone sense.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 10 feet, climb 10 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
bite +18 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d12+8 piercing plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27)

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
spore sap +7,
**Damage** alluring spores

**Alluring Spores**  ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 19 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** [fascinated](/Conditions.aspx?ID=14) by the yaiafineti (1 round); **Stage 2** [controlled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=6) by the yaiafineti (1 round)

**Feed** <actions string="Three Actions" />  The yaiafineti draws nutrients from a living creature it has swallowed, regaining 3d8+24 HP. The swallowed creature takes 2d12+8 bludgeoning damage.

**[Swallow Whole](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=35)** <actions string="Single Action" />  Medium, 2d12+8 bludgeoning, Rupture 18

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_5_TreasureAndRewards.png">Violet Dusk Poppy Dye</title>

Some natives of the Crown of the World hunt yaiafineti matriarchs and harvest their petals, which are used to create an expensive, glimmering violet dye. Although the polyps are far less useful for this purpose, skilled trackers follow their vine tracks back to their matriarch.
</aside>
name: Yaiafineti
